description: Triangle of numbers obtained by inverting infinite matrix defined in A059369, read from right to left.
mathematica: nmax = 10; t[n_, k_] := t[n, k] = Sum[(m+1)!*t[n-m-1, k-1], {m, 0, n-k}]; t[n_, 1] = n!; t[n_, n_] = 1; tnk = Table[t[n, k], {n, 1, nmax}, {k, 1, nmax}]; Reverse /@ Inverse[tnk] // DeleteCases[#, 0, 2]& // Flatten (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jun 14 2013 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 28 2001
